Package game_code

Class Ship

java.lang.Object
game_code.Ship
public class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
The ship class, representing the ship that the player sails around in.
Author:
nzoli

      The combat strength of the ship

    • cargo

      public java.util.Hashtable<Good,​java.lang.Integer> cargo
      The cargo that the ship is currently carrying Initialization of the hash table requires non-primitive data types So int is replaced with its wrapper class Integer - Good thing to remember if using this in the future! Maps instances of Good to integers, representing how many of that good the ship contains. Capacity management should be done in the island's selling/buying methods - specifically the validPurchase method. Likewise, checking if there is enough of the item to sell should also be done in validPurchase. This property is public due to the sheer frequency and variety of ways that we must access it.

    • upgrades

      private java.util.HashSet<Upgrade> upgrades
      The upgrades that the ship currently has

    • location

      private Island location
      The current location of the ship

  • Constructor Details

    • Ship

      public Ship​(java.lang.String name, int capacity, int crew, int speed)
      The constructor for the Ship class. As these values do not have defaults, this is the only way a ship should be initialized. Doubly so because this initiates a ship's cargo array!
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the ship
      capacity - How much cargo weight the ship can carry
      crew - How many crew members the ship has
      speed - The travel speed of the ship

  • Method Details

    • createCargo

      private void createCargo​(java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​Good> ECONOMY)
      Use a loop to iterate through a variable of GameEnvironment that holds all the goods. use that to then set up the cargo, and use that for the constructor. Update the UML diagram accordingly.
      Parameters:
      ECONOMY - The economy that the ship works in: a set of goods it is able to store

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of the ship.
      Returns:
      name of the ship, in string form.

    • getEndurance

      public int getEndurance()
      Gets the endurance of the ship
      Returns:
      ship's endurance, in integer form.

    • getCapacity

      public int getCapacity()
      Gets the cargo capacity of the ship
      Returns:
      ship's cargo capacity, in integer form.

    • changeCapacity

      public void changeCapacity​(int amount)
      increases the capacity by the given amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - Increases capacity by this amount. For reduction, make this negative.

    • changeCargo

      public void changeCargo​(Good product, int quantity)
      increases the quantity of the given Good by the given amount.
      Parameters:
      product - The Good instance you are increasing the quantity of
      quantity - The quantity of goods you're adding. For reduction, make this negative.

    • getCrew

      public int getCrew()
      Gets the number of crew members aboard the ship
      Returns:
      number of ship's crew members, in integer form.

    • getCrewCost

      public int getCrewCost()
      Calculates and gets the cost for paying the crew one day's wage
      Returns:
      one day's wages for the entire crew, in integer form.

    • getSpeed

      public int getSpeed()
      gets the travel speed of the ship
      Returns:
      ship's travel speed, in integer form.

    • getFirePower

      public int getFirePower()
      gets the ship's fire power. Will be zero by default, unless the ship possesses upgrades. This is the bonus the ship gets to its combat roll.
      Returns:
      ship's combat bonus, in integer form.

    • getUpgrades

      public java.util.HashSet<Upgrade> getUpgrades()
      Gets the list of upgrades that the ship currently has.
      Returns:
      Upgrades the ship has active. In ArrayList Form.

    • getLocation

      public Island getLocation()
      Gets the current island the ship is docked at.
      Returns:
      The island that the ship is docked at - in Island class form.

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation​(Island destination)
      sets the location that the island is docked at. Should be used after a ship has traveled/finished its journey.
      Parameters:
      destination - the Island (class) that the ship is currently docked at.

    • addUpgrade

      public void addUpgrade​(Upgrade upgrade)
      Adds an upgrade to the ship. This is done by modifying the ship's properties, which saves us having to use a bunch of if-statements elsewhere. The upgrade will only be added after its effects have been applied, to ensure that only valid upgrades are stored.
      Parameters:
      upgrade - The upgrade to be added. Should be one of the five upgrades - in its class form.

    • setEndurance

      public void setEndurance​(int value)
      sets the endurance of the ship - mainly used for damage.
      Parameters:
      value - the value of the ship's endurance. A higher value indicates a more damaged ship.
